page.title: 03ST.HELEN'S CHURCH,GROVE.
page.content: The Parish of Grove has not had a resident vicar for 32 years,when Rev.Padgell died.In the meantime, Services have gradually been curtailled.This summer they were reduced to two a month, one being Holy Communion.The bells are now rung only on special occasions. The congregation now averages only eight and there is only one warden in office.Weeds are now growing from the top of the tower and the church is falling into a state of disrepair. The rectory is now used as a private dwelling and its former stables,now housing the Village Hall, urgently need repair and decoration. The church is reached by a grass path from a Lych Gate and passing through the churchyard.The oldest marked grave is dated 1766. Visitors are now on the increase and include many from the U.S.A.
